Project

"The Church Sessions"
Acoustic Recording Sessions

32 Artists, 4 Days, 1 Historic Location.

Country Rebel welcomed 32 of the most promising and talented country music artists to the century-old Nashville Vineyard Church to record some of the most stunning acoustic footage the company has ever seen. Filmed during the annual Country Radio Seminar Week in Nashville, a small and nimble team of highly-skilled videographers and sound technicians were able to capture more than 115 individual songs throughout the four days.

Click Above For Full Session Playlist

What I Worked On

Leading the pack, I held a key role in ensuring the recording sessions kept moving - just like clockwork. As the production manager, I outfitted the entire team and crew with all needed equipment, whether from our setup or rented from a production house. Taking the role of director came naturally to me and every piece of the set, camera equipment, lighting, and data ingestion ran as smooth as butter. Tasked with optimizing microphone positioning, I also absorbed the duties of the on-set audio engineer. All combined, these three pivotal roles required a clear mind and active engagement in each part of the production.

Within post-production, I supervised two separate editors to maintain our high standards and commitment to quality for all deliverables. While supervising, I also prepared the content and YouTube channel for the future launch. Each video was an integral and time-sensitive part of our overall outward marketing push. This work held elements of project management, quality assurance, and skilled communication when working with talent management contacts.
